name: HL7FHIRNewZealandBaseImplementationGuide
title: HL7® FHIR® New Zealand Base Implementation Guide

resource.name: Common NZ Address datatype
resource.description: Adds building name, suburb, domicile code and geocode to the Address datatype

resource.name: Condition resource for use in NZ
resource.description: This profile adds the Long-Term Condition extension to the base Condition resource

resource.name: Common NZ ContactPoint datatype
resource.description: This profile adds the Contact Point Purpose and EDI address extensions to the standard data type

resource.name: Coverage resource for use in NZ (Trial use)
resource.description: Coverage resource for use in NZ (Trial use)

resource.description: The base New Zealand Patient profile

resource.name: Practitioner resource for use in NZ
resource.description: Practitioner resource for use in NZ

resource.name: AdditionalAuthorisation
resource.description: Additional authorisations that a practitioner is authorised to perform

resource.name: AliasType
resource.description: Used to indicate what sort of alias is being used in a Location or Organization - eg that it is a legal name.

resource.name: Building Name
resource.description: The name of a building cited in an address.

resource.name: ConditionOnPractice
resource.description: A full description of the conditions the health practitioner is subject to in relation to their scope of practice.

resource.name: A specific purpose for which this ContactPoint dataType would be used
resource.description: A specific purpose for which this ContactPoint dataType would be used. An example would be to indicate that this ContactPoint is used for video conferencing.

resource.name: Date of death
resource.description: The date of death of the individual, plus the source of that information

resource.name: District Health Board linked to a NZ Healthcare Service, Location or Patient
resource.description: District Health Board relating to a NZ Healthcare Service, Location (Facility) or Patient (primary, physical home address).

resource.name: NZ Domicile Code
resource.description: NZ Domicile Code. Derived from a patient's primary physical, home address.

resource.name: EDI Address
resource.description: Represents an Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) address. It is intended as an extension on ContactPoint.system, with the system value being 'other'. The value of the extension is the EDI supplier, the actual EDI address is the value element. Note that a new extension 'messaging address' is preferred.

resource.name: EducationalQualification
resource.description: Educational qualifications a practitioner has. These may or may not be related to registration information.

resource.name: Established
resource.description: The period over which the location or Organization is open

resource.name: Funded Healthcare Programme
resource.description: Funded NZ Healthcare Programmes

resource.name: Information Source
resource.description: The official source of information held about a patient.

resource.name: Long Term Condition Indicator
resource.description: Long Term Condition Indicator. A long term condition can be  defined as any ongoing, long term or recurring conditions that can have a significant impact on people’s lives.

resource.name: Messaging Address
resource.description: The address to where electronic communications might be sent. For historical reasons, there is an overlap with edi-address.

resource.name: NZResidency
resource.description: NZ Residency status

resource.name: NZ Citizenship
resource.description: New Zealand citizenship

resource.name: NZ Ethnicity
resource.description:
The ethnic group or groups that a person identifies with or feels they belong to.  Ethnicity is a measure of cultural affiliation as opposed to race, ancestry, nationality or citizen.  Ethnicity is self-perceived and a person can belong to more than one group.

The Stats New Zealand standard can be found [here](http://aria.stats.govt.nz/aria/#ClassificationView:uri=http://stats.govt.nz/cms/ClassificationVersion/YVqOcFHSlguKkT17).

resource.name: NZ Geocode
resource.description: New Zealand Geocode. This uses a different datum from that defined in the HL7 FHIR specification for a Geocode.

resource.name: Nz_iwi
resource.description: Persons Iwi affiliation

resource.name: NZePS Long Term Medication Indicator
resource.description: NZePS Long Term Medication Indicator

resource.name: NZePS Supply Period Reason
resource.description: The reason for a non-standard Supply Period.

resource.name: NZePS Unusual Dose Quantity Indicator
resource.description: NZePS Unusual Dose Quantity Indicator

resource.name: Primary Healthcare Organisation
resource.description: Primary Healthcare Organisation associated with a General Practice linked to a NZ Healthcare Service, Location (Facility) or Patient (GP).

resource.name: PractitionerRoleCreator
resource.description: The organisation and person that created this role

resource.name: PractitionerRoleStatusReason
resource.description: The reason for the status. Generally only used for inactive resources.

resource.name: RegistrationInitialDate
resource.description: The date the practitioner first became registered with the Responsible Authority or professional body

resource.name: RegistrationStatusCode
resource.description: An indicator of the practicing status of the practitioner as supplied by their Responsible Authority or professional body.

resource.name: ScopeOfPractice
resource.description: The type or range of health services a practitioner is authorised to perform, as determined by the Responsible Authority or professional body.

resource.name: Sex At Birth
resource.description: A person’s sex at the time of their birth (considered to be immutable).

resource.description: Suburb element of a NZ Address.

resource.description: The complete set of alias types that apply to Locations and Organizations

resource.name: Ethnicity of a person
resource.description:
Codes to record a person's ethnicity, drawn from [Level 4 of the Ethnicity code system](http://aria.stats.govt.nz/aria/#ClassificationView:uri=http://stats.govt.nz/cms/ClassificationVersion/YVqOcFHSlguKkT17)
Note that the correct version of the ethicity code system is 2.1.0

resource.name: Scope of practice
resource.description: A classification of the type or range of health services that a practitioner is authorised to provide, as determined by the Responsible Authority or other statutory authority (e.g. PHARMAC), that is, what the practitioner can or cannot do. It includes Scope of Practice as defined by the Health Practitioners Competence Assurance Act 2003, any special authorisations granted, and any conditions or limitations imposed by the Responsible Authority.
